New Records: Corey Seager became the first purely left-handed-hitting shortstop in Major League history to hit 200 home runs.
Key Match Events: Corey Seager hit his 200th career home run, a 406-foot blast to right, in the fourth inning of the Rangers’ 2-1 win over the White Sox.
Nathan Eovaldi allowed just one hit and two walks in seven scoreless innings, striking out 10 batters.
Post-Match Reflections: Nathan Eovaldi expressed satisfaction with his fastball location and overall performance.
Corey Seager and Marcus Semien reflected on their home run potential and contributions to the team's success.
Manager Bruce Bochy praised Seager's hitting abilities and work ethic.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Rangers completed a three-game sweep of the White Sox at Guaranteed Rate Field.
Nathan Eovaldi's four-seam fastball averaged 96.2 mph and maxed at 98.1 mph, an uptick from his season average.
